intro: Lomandra, commonly known as the grass tree, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. These plants are characterized by their tall, grass-like leaves and striking, cone-shaped inflorescences. They are typically found in a variety of habitats, including coastal areas, dry forests, and heathlands. Lomandra species are well adapted to harsh environments, with some species exhibiting fire-resistant properties. Their unique appearance and ecological significance make them an important part of Australia's native flora.
